title: Impulse - force-time graph for two carts

content.question: The graph shows force as a function of time for two carts of different masses. The carts are on straight, horizontal tracks and the forces are exerted parallel to the track. Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> has mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> has mass <math alttext="2 m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi></mstyle><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Is the impulse delivered to Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> greater than that of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> for the time period from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the force on Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> increases to a value greater than that of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.

Yes, because the slope of the graph is greater for Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> than Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.

No, because the mass of Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is twice that of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>.
No, because the areas under the curve for both cars are equal.

content.answer: No, because the areas under the curve for both cars are equal.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
